title: Who We Are - System Change Not Climate Change

last_post.content:
System change — can it really happen? The odds might be against it, the powers that be *certainly* are against it, but we'll never know if it's possible unless we try, until we give it everything we have.

Some info about one of the groups organizing around this effort...
________________________

System Change Not Climate Change (SCNCC) is a network of North American ecosocialists united in the belief that capitalism is driving climate change, and that a radical international grassroots movement can stop it.

As the ecological crisis deepens, a parade of false solutions will be promoted: from spraying reflective aerosols into the upper atmosphere, to building thousands of new nuclear power plants, to deploying non-existent "clean coal" and carbon capture and storage technologies.

These fantasies will not save us. We need a democratically run, planned economy to serve people and life on Earth by rapidly and radically reducing our fossil fuel consumption and poisoning of the planet.

Green capitalism is a dead end. So are liberal parties like the US Democrats and Canadian Liberals, and the corporate-friendly approach of most Green NGOs.

SCNCC envisions a climate justice movement united with the labor movement, First Nations/Indigenous and other struggles for liberation, to create an alternative to the upside-down world shaped by fossil fuels and corporate power.
________________________

MORE HERE -- https://systemchangenotclimatechange.org/points-of-unity/

#Environment #Climate #ClimateChange #ClimateCrisis #ClimateAction #ClimateEmergency #Anticapitalism

If you went to Carnegie-Mellon in the late 1980s, you probably took a Pascal course, like 15-111, that was taught with the #Pascal Genie, a "structured editor" that allowed programmers to write syntactically valid Pascal programs without worrying about questions like "Did I forget a semicolon?" Older folks used the #VAX 11/780 version, younger folks used it on a Mac.

I managed to find a copy of it to run in emulation, and walk through it in this video, while writing a program that would absolutely get an F from Phil Miller and Mark Stehlik. Please check it out and share with people you think might be interested

https://youtu.be/FXx1JGibSz4

I'm a bit nervous posting this since both @psu_13 and @kvd worked on the Genie and I probably made 50 mistakes in this video that they will be able to correct.

#retro #retrocomputing #programming

title: BuzzFeed News is being shut down

last_post.content:
The end of the social web is just really something.

Here’s former BuzzFeed News editor-in-chief (and now Semafor co-founder) Ben Smith on the shutdown of BuzzFeed News.

> “Peretti had built BuzzFeed into a traffic juggernaut by being among the first to see the rising social web. But BuzzFeed never found a new path when that trend turned against us — when consumers found their Facebook feeds toxic, not delightful; when platforms decided news was poison; and when Facebook, Twitter, and the rest simply stopped distributing links to websites.”

https://www.semafor.com/article/04/20/2023/the-end-of-the-buzzfeed-era-in-news
